Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface PersonHistory

All Superinterfaces:
Abstraction.TemporalState<Person>, PersonTemporalState, Serializable
@Immutable public interface PersonHistory extends PersonTemporalState
Historical patient data relevant to the ongoing simulation. Some of this is copied from the patients state, and some is updated by patient behaviour. Notably this is where contacts, and testing is stored as the history of both are needed. The simulation stores enough history for an individual to inform the current state (decided in terms of multiples of the infectious period).
See Also:
  • PersonTemporalState
  • Person
  • Outbreak

  • Method Details

    • getHistoricalContacts

      default Stream<Contact> getHistoricalContacts(int limit)
      Retrieves a stream of all Contact objects for this patient made within the last X days (inclusive of today). This is a modelled quantity, meaning it represents all contacts regardless of whether they were observed. The method operates by concatenating the getTodaysContacts() with the results of recursively calling getHistoricalContacts(int)-1 on the getPrevious() day.
      Parameters:
      limit - The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only today).
      Returns:
      A Stream of Contact objects from the specified historical period.

    • getHistoricalTests

      default Stream<TestResult> getHistoricalTests(int limit)
      Retrieves a stream of all TestResult objects for this patient taken within the last N days (inclusive of today). This includes tests of all statuses (e.g., PENDING, POSITIVE, NEGATIVE). The method operates by concatenating the getTodaysTests() with the results of recursively calling getHistoricalTests(int)-1 on the getPrevious() day.
      Parameters:
      limit - The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only today).
      Returns:
      A Stream of TestResult objects from the specified historical period.

    • getInfectionStart

      @Lazy @Deprecated default Optional<PersonHistory> getInfectionStart()
      Deprecated.
      If the person is currently infectious, this method finds the PersonHistory state at the point in time they first became infectious. This is determined by:
      1. Checking if the current state PersonTemporalState.isInfectious() and PersonTemporalState.isIncidentInfection(). If both are true, this is the infection start.
      2. Otherwise, recursively calling getPrevious() and checking its getInfectionStart() until the incident infection is found.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the PersonHistory at the start of the infection, or empty if not infectious.

    • getInfectiousContact

      @Deprecated @Lazy default Optional<Exposure> getInfectiousContact()
      Deprecated.
      For a newly infected person, this method finds the Exposure event that represents the maximal viral exposure on the first day before the subject became infectious. This exposure is considered the primary infectious contact from an "infector". The calculation involves:
      1. Identifying if there's a getNewInfection() on this day.
      2. If so, finding the getLastExposure() leading up to this new infection.
      3. From the getLastExposure(), streaming through getTodaysExposures() and finding the one with the maximum Exposure.getExposure() value.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the Exposure with the maximal viral dose, or empty if not found.

    • getInfector

      @Deprecated @Lazy default Optional<PersonHistory> getInfector()
      Deprecated.
      For a newly infected person, this method identifies the PersonHistory of the individual who transmitted the infection (the "infector"). The process involves:
      1. Finding the Exposure event with the maximal viral exposure using getInfectiousContact().
      2. Retrieving the PersonHistory of the exposer from that Exposure event.
      3. Determining the getInfectionStart() for that exposer to pinpoint the exact moment of their infection.
      This ensures that all infections originating from a single infector map back to the same infection start time for that infector.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the PersonHistory of the infector at their infection start, or empty if not found.

    • getLastExposure

      default Optional<PersonHistory> getLastExposure()
      Finds the PersonHistory state at the start of the last episode of exposure to the virus. An "episode" is defined as a continuous run of exposures separated by less than one infectious period. The method works by:
      1. Checking if the current state PersonTemporalState.isIncidentExposure(). If true, this is the last exposure start.
      2. Otherwise, recursively calling getPrevious() and checking its getLastExposure() until the incident exposure is found.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the PersonHistory at the start of the last exposure episode, or empty if no recent exposure.

    • getMaxDelay

      @Derived default int getMaxDelay()
      Calculates the maximum delay among all TestResult objects taken on the current day. This value is used when assembling the forward-looking list of test results, organized by sample date, including the delay distribution. The method streams through getTodaysTests() and finds the maximum value of TestResult.getDelay().
      Returns:
      The maximum test result delay in days for tests taken today, or 0 if no tests were taken.

    • getNewInfection

      @Deprecated @Lazy default Optional<PersonHistory> getNewInfection()
      Deprecated.
      Determines if a person became newly infectious on this specific day. This is distinct from being newly exposed. The method checks if the current PersonHistory state is an PersonTemporalState.isIncidentInfection().
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the current PersonHistory if the person is newly infectious today, otherwise empty.

    • getNext

      default Optional<PersonHistory> getNext()
      Retrieves the PersonHistory entry for the day immediately following the current day. This is achieved by querying the associated Person entity for its history at (this.getTime() + 1).
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the PersonHistory for the next day, or empty if not available.

    • getPrevious

      default Optional<PersonHistory> getPrevious()
      Retrieves the PersonHistory entry for the day immediately preceding the current day. This is achieved by querying the associated Person entity for its history at (this.getTime() - 1).
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the PersonHistory for the previous day, or empty if not available.

    • getPrevious

      default Stream<PersonHistory> getPrevious(int limit)
      Recursively collects a stream of PersonHistory entries for the current day and the limit preceding days. If limit is 0, only the current PersonHistory is returned. Otherwise, it concatenates the current history with the result of calling getPrevious(limit - 1).
      Parameters:
      limit - The number of previous days to include in the stream (0-based, so 0 means only today).
      Returns:
      A Stream of PersonHistory objects, starting from the current day and going backwards.

    • getResultsBySampleDate

      default Stream<TestResult> getResultsBySampleDate(int time)
      Retrieves a stream of TestResult objects that were sampled on the current day and have their results available by a specified future time. The method calculates the difference between the specified time and the current time. If the difference is negative, an empty stream is returned. Otherwise, it filters getTodaysTests() to include only those tests for which TestResult.isResultAvailable(int) is true at the given time.
      Parameters:
      time - The future time at which to check for result availability.
      Returns:
      A Stream of TestResult objects sampled today with results available by the specified time.

    • getStillRelevantDetectedContacts

      default Stream<Contact> getStillRelevantDetectedContacts()
      Retrieves a stream of Contact objects that occurred within the last presumed infectious period and were detected. This is an observed quantity. The method filters the getHistoricalContacts(int) (using PersonTemporalState.infPeriod() as the limit) to include only those contacts for which Contact.isDetected() returns true.
      Returns:
      A Stream of detected Contact objects relevant to the current infectious period.

    • getStillRelevantTests

      default Stream<TestResult> getStillRelevantTests()
      Retrieves a stream of TestResult objects that are still considered relevant based on the presumed infectious period. This is an observed quantity, meaning it reflects tests whose results would be considered impactful given the disease's progression. The method calls getHistoricalTests(int) with the value returned by PersonTemporalState.infPeriod() as the limit.
      Returns:
      A Stream of TestResult objects relevant to the current infectious period.

    • getTodaysContacts

      Contact[] getTodaysContacts()
      A list of contacts made in this time period and their weight from the perspective of transmission (i.e. context). Weights might be less if for example the participants are wearing masks. In the future we might build contact venue into this context. This array is populated by the simulation based on the social network and mobility models.
      Returns:
      An array of Contact objects representing contacts made today.

    • getTodaysExposures

      Exposure[] getTodaysExposures()
      A list of exposures made in this time period. These are contacts who are infectious. This array is derived from getTodaysContacts() by filtering for contacts with infectious individuals and successful transmission events.
      Returns:
      An array of Exposure objects representing exposures that occurred today.

    • getTodaysResults

      @Lazy default List<TestResult> getTodaysResults()
      Collects a list of TestResult objects that generate a result on the current day, regardless of when the test was taken. This method looks backwards over all possibly relevant tests (up to the infectious period). It streams through getStillRelevantTests() and filters them using TestResult.isResultToday(int) with the current time. Note that tests with very long processing times relative to the infectious period might not be picked up.
      Returns:
      A List of TestResult objects whose results become available today.

    • getTodaysTests

      List<TestResult> getTodaysTests()
      The list of tests taken on this day. Initially the result will be marked as PENDING until the test is processed. (the true result is available internally to the model immediately, but not necessarily observed). This list is populated by the simulation engine when a person undergoes a test.
      Returns:
      A List of TestResult objects representing tests taken today.

    • isContinuously

      default boolean isContinuously(Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit)
      Checks if a given test condition (a Predicate on PersonTemporalState) has been true continuously every day for the last limit days, including the current day. The method works by first checking the current day. If the test is false, it immediately returns false. Otherwise, it recursively calls isContinuously(Predicate, int) on the getPrevious() day with a decremented limit, returning false if no previous history exists or the limit is reached.
      Parameters:
      test - The Predicate to apply to each PersonTemporalState.
      limit - The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only today).
      Returns:
      true if the test condition was met continuously throughout the period, false otherwise.

    • isRecently

      default boolean isRecently(Predicate<PersonTemporalState> test, int limit)
      Checks if a given test condition (a Predicate on PersonTemporalState) has been true at least once within the last limit days, including the current day. The method works by first checking the current day. If the test is true, it returns true. Otherwise, it recursively calls isRecently(Predicate, int) on the getPrevious() day with a decremented limit, returning false if no previous history exists or the limit is reached.
      Parameters:
      test - The Predicate to apply to each PersonTemporalState.
      limit - The number of days to look back (0-based, so 0 means only today).
      Returns:
      true if the test condition was met at least once in the period, false otherwise.
